metadata.title: CVE-2017-7859 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
FFmpeg before 2017-03-05 has an out-of-bounds write caused by a heap-basedbuffer overflow related to the ff_h264_slice_context_init function inlibavcodec/h264dec.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7859` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.3.3-1
libav-tools - 7:3.3.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.3.3-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.3.3-1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.3.3-1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.3.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.3.3-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.3.3-1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.3.3-1
libavformat57 - 7:3.3.3-1
libavresample3 - 7:3.3.3-1
libavutil55 - 7:3.3.3-1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.3.3-1
libswresample2 - 7:3.3.3-1
libswscale4 - 7:3.3.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.3.3-1').
